title: Count Floyd
description:
This self-titled debut "mini LP" from SCTV&#039;s Count Floyd (Joe Flaherty) was released in November, 1982. Unfortunately, it has been out of print for well over two decades and has never been available on CD -- at least not officially.

Backed up by the Wally Hung Experience (formerly the Wally Hung Trio, and in reality comprised of Paul Flaherty, Dick Blasucci, Mike Short and others), Floyd starts off by telling the "Gory Story Of Duane And Debbie", then gets romantic himself on "Treat You Like A Lady". These are followed by "Reggae Christmas Eve In Transylvania" which is sure to become a holiday classic in someone&#039;s house. The four-song set finishes with the Count filling in for the Rolling Stones in "Count Floyd Is Back".

This is my rip from relatively clean vinyl; there&#039;s a few ticks in places and a bit of sibilance, but it sounds at least as good as the MP3s that have been floating around for a few years now. Plus it&#039;s lossless (FLAC) and I&#039;ve included disc and case artwork...

More information is available at http://www.sctvguide.ca/episodes/as_floyd.htm#Count_Floyd_LP
